alert.note: Alert for Central Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 3:49PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Sagavanirktok River near Dalton Highway from Mileposts 401 to 407. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flood waters are eroding the Dalton Highway between Milepost 401 and 407, with the road down to one lane. If conditions worsen, the road may wash out and become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 330 PM AKDT Monday, the Sagavanirktok River continues to flow overbank due to remnant ice in the main channel. This is forcing the water to flow west and cause erosion along the Dalton Highway from Milepost 401 to 407. These conditions are expected to persist until ice in the main channel clears. - Recent heavy rain and snowmelt in the Brooks Range continues to cause high water on the Sagavanirktok River. Another round of rain is expected Monday night through Wednesday with additional rainfall totals of 0.75 inches in the headwaters. This will result rising water levels on the Sagavanirktok River through Thursday. - http://wweather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: Travelers are urged to call 511 or visit 511.alaska.gov for the latest on road conditions in the area.
